Locations:  Carmel, Indiana or Eagan, Minnesota

 Are you looking for a "high-powered" internship for the Summer of 2021?  Are you ready to make a difference and bring your great ideas to help MISO keep the lights on?  If so, read on...

We need a diversified group of smart, motivated problem solvers to overcome challenges that face the Energy industry as it rapidly changes.  As a MISO Intern, you will address business opportunities and make an impact!

As our MISO Intern, you will...

  • Participate on projects that build on and broaden your technical skills and will prepare you for future roles as leaders and change agents.  
  • Be given the opportunity to present your project results, and make recommendations to your department, team members, and company leadership.  
  • Have a manager and mentor with the team you join, as well as a "buddy" from a different department for additional MISO connections.

In light of the current conditions, MISO is committed to the health and safety of our employees. As we plan for our 2021 Summer Internship Program you can expect to...

  • Work an average of 30 - 40 hours per week
  • Have a virtual, in office, or hybrid experience 
  • Start the middle/end of May and end mid-August

Qualifications:

  • Coming into this role you would have completed your junior year of college
  • Demonstration of MISO Core Values:  Integrity, Commitment, Collaboration, Creativity, and Adaptability
  • Strong problem solver who is able to break down information; help determine best practices
  • Process mind-set 

We are looking for students with the following majors/areas of interest:

  • Computer Science
  • Software Programming (Python)
  • Cloud (AWS or Azure)
  • Data Science courses a plus
  • Github version control

MISO manages the electricity superhighway in the Central U.S. Through use of groundbreaking research and advanced technology, our highly skilled employees ensure power flows reliably to 42 million customers. Operating the electricity grid, running a robust energy market, planning for a bright future - it's what our immensely talented and dedicated team does every day.

To learn more about MISO's Internship Program, check out the following links:

MISO in 90 Seconds

MISO's Intern Experience

MISO Energy

Job Description:

SUMMARY

ShopStyle Collective is looking for a dynamic Data Science intern. You will be responsible for building and owning the next generation of search and content recommendation as well as other algorithms/systems that will make the experience for our many influencers and their followers personalized and unique. You'll have the opportunity get to work closely with BI and our business partners to analyze business engagement content data to drive informed decisions and build predictive models on large-scale datasets to address various business problems through applying advanced statistical modeling, machine learning, or deep learning techniques. The role provides access to multiple functional areas to develop a deep understanding of the business and a great opportunity to make an impact on the company's success in the short and long-term.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Make sense of text and image content data using NLP and deep learning approaches
  • Research and develop state-of-the-art ML solutions to address web Bot fraud Research technologies and define architectural improvements
  • Build prototypes or core features
  • Research and implement algorithms to optimize customer marketing experience using approaches such as reinforcement learning, HMM and/or deep learning
  • Build predictive models on large-scale datasets to address various business problems through applying advanced statistical modeling, machine learning, or deep learning techniques

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  • Currently enrolled in a Master's or PhD program in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Statistics, or equivalent
  • Deep understanding of statistical modeling and machine learning concepts
  • Familiar with one or more machine learning or statistical modeling tools such as R, SciKitLearn, SparkMLib, Tensorflow
  • Experience using Python or R; SQL a plus
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to tell a complete narrative using data to a variety of audiences

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Graduation date between December 2021 and June 2022
  • Relevant major/area of study
  • Minimum GPA of 3.2
  • Relevant prior internship experience (preferred)

Micron’s vision is to transform how the world uses information to enrich life for all. ​ Join an inclusive team focused on one thing: using our expertise in the relentless pursuit of innovation for customers and partners. The solutions we create help make everything from virtual reality experiences to breakthroughs in neural networks possible. We do it all while committing to integrity, sustainability, and giving back to our communities. Because doing so can spark the very innovation we are pursuing. 

 

Req. ID: 252942 

 

As a Data Scientist Intern at Micron, you will learn about the exciting field of complex data science, using state of the art solutions to monitor and improve next generation memory solutions. We will enable this with ground breaking approaches and next generation data modeling and solutions.

 

We will assign you a project to develop critical thinking and problem-solving skills. Your research tasks are designed to optimize and improve predictability of inline process signals. Through this project we will provide the opportunity for you to collaborate with engineering interns across design, product and system engineering. At the end of the period, we want the cohort to have a good understanding of DRAM / NAND flash memory products and  how you can apply machine learning to solve complex semiconductor problems.

 

Responsibilities:

  • Develop supervised / unsupervised machine learning models using both structured and unstructured data
  • Exploratory data analysis
  • Possess a continuous improvement process (CIP) mentality looking for ways to improve the predictive model, and how to make a difference today!
  • Recognize, identify, and raise awareness of data anomalies with the motivation of "who needs to know this now!"
  • We want our intern to use statistical modeling that seek the problems that inhibit product / system development
  • You will uncover patterns in the data from which predictive models, impactful insights or solutions can be developed with the mentality of "how can I improve this?"
  • Learn how our customers use the data today with the intent of improving the user experience
  • Work closely and collaborate with subject matter experts
  • Develop a good understanding of how the feedback loops work with key customers by building positive relationships
  • We expect active participation in technical meetings and then synthesize from it new opportunities or novel approaches

 

Successful candidates for this position will have:

  • Pursuing a Master’s or PhD Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, or related field. Semiconductor industry experience is helpful; however, other engineering or related fields may be considered. Graduation date cannot be prior to September 2021.
  • Machine learning and other sophisticated analytical methods
  • Hadoop, Snowflake, Teradata and/or another SQL databases
  • Good data summary and social skills with a strong attention to detail
  • Working with time series data, images, and data with frequently changing distributions is a plus

We need strong critical thinking, prioritization, and analytical skills while providing insights to drive strategic direction

 

About Micron Technology, Inc.

We are an industry leader in innovative memory and storage solutions. Through our global brands – Micron® and Crucial® – our broad portfolio of high-performance memory and storage technologies, including DRAM, NAND, 3D XPoint™ memory and NOR, is transforming how the world uses information to enrich life. Backed by more than 40 years of technology leadership, our memory and storage solutions enable disruptive trends, including artificial intelligence, 5G, machine learning and autonomous vehicles, in key market segments like mobile, data center, client, consumer, industrial, graphics, automotive, and networking. Our common stock is traded on the Nasdaq under the MU symbol. To learn more visit micron.com/careers

 

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

 

Micron prohibits the use of child labor and complies with all applicable laws, rules, regulations and other international and industry labor standards.

Be involved with a company that is changing the lives of people across the globe.

ARKRAY is currently hiring a Science and Regulatory Intern who has an interest in supporting ongoing pre-market development projects, contributing to FDA submissions, conducting quality control testing of commercialized products, and expanding their knowledge of the in vitro diagnostic (IVD) medical device industry.

This internship will be for thespring semester and also offers the opportunity to take ownership of a semester long project of your own. You will choose a topic within ARKRAY's purview that interests you and, with the approval of your supervising scientist, plan, research, experiment, and report on your topic of interest.

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Review and prepare study protocols.
  • Participate in lab testing of different IVD products.
  • Capture test results, perform basic data analyses, and prepare draft study reports.
  • Support related administrative activities.
  • Complete one project of your choosing.
  • Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

Knowledge and Skills

  • Undergraduate or Graduate students pursuing degrees in Chemistry, Biology, Life Sciences, Engineering, Regulatory Affairs, or similar fields. Recent graduates are also eligible to apply.
  • Have a grade point average of 3.0 or better (on a 4.0 scale).
  • Basic computer skills and knowledge of common programs such as Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
  • Familiarity with statistical analysis tools or related course work is preferred.
  • Eligible to work in the United States.

ARKRAY is an Equal Opportunity Employer: minorities, women, veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

position: Advanced Computer Vision & Graphics Research Intern
description:
Sony Corporation of America, located inNew York, NY, is the U.S. headquarters of Sony Corporation, based in Tokyo, Japan. Sony's principal U.S. businesses include Sony Electronics Inc., Sony Mobile Communications (USA) Inc., Sony Interactive Entertainment LLC., Sony Pictures Entertainment Inc., Sony Music Entertainment, and Sony/ATV Music Publishing LLC. With some 900 million Sony devices in hands and homes worldwide today, a vast array of Sony movies, television shows and music, and the PlayStation Network, Sony creates and delivers more entertainment experiences to more people than anyone else on earth. To learn more: www.sony.com.

Sony Corporation of America currently has an opening for an Advanced Computer Vision and Graphics Research intern in our R&D Center US, San Jose Lab.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to collaborate with a talented research team in multidisciplinary efforts to develop Sony's future products and services. We're inventing the technology and products that inspire customers all over the world, and soon you could be working to bring your ideas to life! This internship is a great opportunity to gain valuable experience in exciting entertainment industry applications as well as cutting-edge research experience in the field of advanced computer vision and graphics.

If you're up to the challenge, we'd love to see what you've got!

Responsibilities:

  • Research and evaluate the performance of state-of-the-art computer vision and graphics algorithms.

  • Apply software engineering skills to prototype algorithms to identify challenges for our research.

  • Learn, collaborate and network alongside world-class researchers to investigate algorithms; present your findings and contribute to industry leading entertainment technology community.

Required qualifications:

  • Ph.D. candidate or Post-doc in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.

  • Research background in the area of computer vision, computer graphics, machine learning, or video processing.

  • Experience and research track record in 3D reconstruction, 3D modeling, image-based rendering, or CG simulation.

  • Familiarity with Matlab, Python or C/C++ for rapid algorithm prototyping.

  • Excellent analytical and mathematical skills.

  • All candidates must be authorized to work in the USA.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience in 3D human modeling.

  • Familiarity with Unity, Unreal Engine, Maya, or related graphic platforms.

Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religious creed, sex (including pregnancy), gender, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, military status, status as a veteran or disabled veteran, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or family status, genetic information, medical condition, or any other basis protected by applicable federal, state, or local law, ordinance, or regulation.

Company: Dolby Laboratories, Inc.

 

 

 

The world is changing as we know it. It's more important than ever that communications and entertainment services are available to users to connect wherever they may be. Here at Dolby, our mission is to enable experiences that transcend expectations and reach the spectacular. We need your creative solutions and diverse thought. The Dolby U internship program offers impactful, project-based work experience in a collaborative, creative environment where you work side by side with industry leaders.

 

Amplify your insatiable curiosity by implementing real-world solutions that revolutionize how people communicate and how entertainment is created, delivered, and enjoyed worldwide. For any student seeking to gain invaluable expertise through meaningful, personal contributions, we invite you to join us in continuing to design a future where technology meets entertainment! 

 

SUMMARY

Dolby's IT Enterprise Applications team is looking for an intern to help take on some application integration projects. You will learn about integration platforms like Informatica Cloud and partner with an experienced developer to provide design and technical guidance. You will have the opportunity to build integrations between enterprise applications and a variety of data sources.

 

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Meet and learn from individuals from Enterprise applications teams and supporting departments to understand how the organization is structured and works together
  • This role will take the intern through a full lifecycle of one or more application projects, including requirements design, development, testing, and deployment Opportunity to learn enterprise-class application integration design patterns related to data integration and business process orchestration
  • Opportunity to master application integrations by building prototypes

 

QUALIFICATIONS

  • The ideal candidate would have strong technical background with knowledge of programming, data sources like files, databases, web services and apis
  • Understanding of Cloud architecture
  • Familiarity with SQL, jQuery, SOAP/RESTful web services desired
  • Good communication, networking, presenting skills
  • Good problem solving, analytical, communication, coordination and task management skills

 

ELIGIBILITY

  • Working towards a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Management Information Systems, Information Technology, or a related field; recent grads who are within 1 year of graduation are also eligible to apply
  • Must be available to work full-time Monday-Friday for 3-months between May/June 2021-August/September 2021.

    • Monday, May 24, 2021
    • Monday, June 14, 2021
    • Monday, June 21, 2021

position: Grad Intern - R&D (Computational Protein Engineering) - Summer 2021
description:
Career CategoryCollege JobJob Description

Job Summary

Amgen's 10 - 13 week internship program offers meaningful project experiences that impact patient's lives. Amgen, a biotechnology pioneer, discovers, develops and delivers innovative human therapeutics. Our medicines have helped millions of patients in the fight against cancer, kidney disease, rheumatoid arthritis and other serious illnesses.

The Protein Technologies team is responsible for designing, planning, and executing on the generation of key enabling DNA and protein reagents to support discovery of small and large molecule therapeutics and cutting-edge novel modalities across Amgen's therapeutic areas.

This internship explores computational methods that leverage both sequence and structural information to design stabilizing mutations, especially at interfaces, into proteins of interest. The successful intern will implement and automate methods and then apply them to a set of test proteins for evaluation. Well-suited applicants will have an interest in protein engineering and the development computational protocols.

The intern will gain hands-on experience in protein design in an industrial setting and will have the opportunity to interact with various functions such as in Protein Technologies and Biologics, Molecular Engineering, and Discovery Analytical Sciences. This opportunity will allow the intern to see first-hand how early-stage large molecule drug development is conducted.

This internship will be conducted remotely.

Basic Qualifications

Amgen requires that all individuals applying for a grad internship or a co-op assignment at Amgen must meet the following criteria:

  • 18 years or older
  • Graduated with a Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university with a 3.0 minimum GPA or equivalent
  • Completion as a first year graduate student before internship starts and currently enrolled in a MBA program for a MBA internship OR a Master's program for a Masters internship OR a PharmD program for a PharmD internship OR PhD for a PhD internship from an accredited college or university
  • Enrolled in an accredited college or university following the potential internship or co-op assignment
  • Must not be employed at the time the internship starts

Preferred Qualifications

  • Degree concentration(s) in Biochemistry, Bioengineering, Chemistry, Biology, or other related Life Science OR Degree concentration in Computer Science with some familiarity with biochemistry
  • Familiarity with protein structure and protein structure visualization using PyMOL or other related software
  • Familiarity with protein structure prediction or design using Rosetta or other related software
  • Knowledge of basic Unix commands

Join Us

If you're seeking a career where you can truly make a difference in the lives of others, a career where you can work at the absolute forefront of biotechnology with the top minds in the field, you'll find it at Amgen.

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Amgen will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

Description

This is an exciting opportunity to be a part ofexperienced, innovative and energetic team on a rapid, agile development schedule. The Intern will participate in the team cloud QA activities which primarily include implementation of product automation tests.

Job Summary

As an QA Intern, you will be responsible for quality of cloud products where you will test and critique software components and interfaces in great technical depth, write test automation frameworks, programs to assure high product quality, and develop advanced test tools using Java to increase productivity and efficiency. You will play a key role in on-time product delivery with high quality and drive customer success. In the role of QA Inter you must be able to work and adapt in a fluid, fast-paced environment. Working as the QA Inter you must have strong technical, communication, collaboration, and leadership skills.

Technology You'll Use:

  • Docker and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure), cloud log services (ELK, Sumo Logic, Splunk), cloud application monitoring tools (Elastic APM, AppDynamics, New Relic)
  • Jenkins and Spinnaker CI/CD tools

What You'll Do

  • You will part of scrum teams and contribute to quality of the products

  • You will participate in product design, development, verification, troubleshooting, and delivery of a system or major subsystems.

Key Essentials

  • You are a team player who strives for excellence.
  • You are comfortable working both independently and collaboratively.
  • Your problem-solving skills and technical aptitudes allow you to adapt to new circumstances and learn quickly when facing new problems and challenges.
  • You are comfortable to work with a wide range of software, including development tools, build systems, and software deployment tools.
  • You have a keen interest in software technologies.

  • Strong oral and written communication is necessary for success
  • Ability to work on a diverse team or with a diverse range of people.
  • Experience with multiple programming languages is a benefit but there is also room to improve your skills.
  • Most entry-level engineers have a level of proficiency in: Java and/or Python

Nice to Have

Career CategoryCollege JobJob Description

Amgen's 10 - 13 week internship program offers meaningful project experiences that impact patient's lives. This internship provides the opportunity for executive and social networking events and to participate in community volunteer projects while providing a competitive compensation.

Limited relocation housing and/or miscellaneous allowance may be available for eligible candidates.

Within Global Development at Amgen we are committed to excellence in clinical trial design and operational execution to enable us to bring more medicines to more patients more quickly. We recently developed new capabilities to support this effort, and we are looking for an undergrad intern to play a key role in enhancing these capabilities.

The Operational Design Team in Global Clinical Program Management has recently implemented a new role to support the design and operational planning of our clinical trial protocols. The Operational Design Analyst (ODA) is a role that helps study teams to curate and interrogate data in a consistent and efficient manner and provide data-driven enrollment projections at the indication, study and country level. The ODA works with product and study teams during trial design, planning and study start-up to drive the use of data sources at Amgen to inform program strategy and the operational design of clinical trials at Amgen. The intern will be supporting the ODAs with process automation and report enhancements and will gain true insight into how to use data to inform strategic planning.

Project Description

The intern in the Operational Design Team will provide process automation for activities related to the use of a clinical trial enrollment modelling tool and will manage the modifications to a Spotfire report to further enhance available insights for local feasibility representatives. The project will include requirements gathering, Spotfire and R or Python development, and user-acceptance testing.

Responsibilities

  • Support the Operational Design Analysts in their work to bring data to teams to help inform program strategy and operational design of clinical trials.
  • Use R or Python to transform datasets into structured formats that enable upload into geo-modelling tool
  • Collaborate with cross functional partners to translate enhancement requests for a Spotfire report into design requirements
  • Create readable and insightful data visualizations in Spotfire based on end user requirements
  • Conduct user-acceptance testing for automated solutions
  • Participate in the Operational Design Team meetings to gain exposure to projects and processes related to study design

Basic Qualifications

  • Amgen requires that all individuals applying for an undergraduate internship or an undergraduate co-op assignment at Amgen must meet the following criteria:
  • 18 years or older
  • Currently enrolled in a full time Bachelor's Degree program from an accredited college or university with a 3.0 minimum GPA or equivalent
  • Completion of one year of study from an accredited college or university prior to the internship commencing
  • Enrolled in a full time Bachelor's degree program following the potential internship or co-op assignment with an accredited college or university
  • Must not be employed at the time the internship starts
  • Possess U.S. citizenship, permanent legal residence, or unrestricted work authorization in the U.S.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Pursuing a Bachelor's degree with a concentration in Data Science/Analytics or Computer Science/Programming
  • Some coursework in Life Sciences or familiarity with drug development and/or clinical trial processes
  • Experience with database development and/or maintenance
  • Ability to program in R or Python
  • Experience with data visualization tools (Spotfire preferred)
  • Ability to pull and summarize data from data sources
  • Junior standing with graduation in Summer 2022
  • Excellent oral/written communication skills and interpersonal skills
  • Excellent time management, decision-making and organizational skills
  • Ability to apply research findings, capture information, interpret and analyze results, develop and implement a logical and strategic plan of action
  • Ability to make supportable recommendations to help achieve department goals
  • Strong project management skills, proficiency in logistic planning from beginning to end, priority setting, timely delivery of results, and multi-tasking
  • Ability to think critically, actively anticipate problems and propose solutions and to work effectively/collaboratively across teams, levels of management, across partnerships, and enable cross-functional collaborations
  • Ability to work independently and with ambiguity
  • Strong computer skills; strong technical use of Microsoft Suite

Join Us

If you're seeking a career where you can truly make a difference in the lives of others, a career where you can work at the absolute forefront of biotechnology with the top minds in the field, you'll find it at Amgen.

Amgen, a biotechnology pioneer, discovers, develops and delivers innovative human therapeutics. Our medicines have helped millions of patients in the fight against cancer, kidney disease, rheumatoid arthritis and other serious illnesses.

As an organization dedicated to improving the quality of life for people around the world, Amgen fosters an inclusive environment of diverse, ethical, committed and highly accomplished people who respect each other but compete intensely to win. Together, we live the Amgen values as we continue advancing science to serve patients.

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Only candidates who apply via http://careers.amgen.com/ will be considered.

position: Center for Global Security Research Intern
description:
Company Description

Join us and make YOUR mark on the World!

Are you interested in joining some of the brightest talent in the world to strengthen the United States’ security? Come join Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory (LLNL) where our employees apply their expertise to create solutions for BIG ideas that make our world a better place.

We are looking for individuals that demonstrate an understanding of working in partnership with team peers, who engage, advocate, and contribute to building an inclusive culture, and provide expertise to solve challenging problems.

Job Description

The Center for Global Security Research (CGSR) was established at Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory (LLNL) in 1996 to bring together experts from the science, technology, and policy communities to address pressing national security challenges. For over 20 years, CGSR has engaged diverse perspectives on topics important to national security, deterrence, diplomacy, dual-use technology, arms control, nonproliferation, peacekeeping, cyber defense and energy security.

We have openings for Intern positions with a Bachelor's or Master's degree taking place from March 1, 2021 to May 24, 2021 to engage in practical research experience to further their educational goals. You may conduct research to support United States (US) policy and decision makers in developing strategies for national and international security. Relevant fields of research include nuclear engineering, computational sciences, materials science and engineering, cyber security, interactive data mining, political science, and international relations.

This job will be closed to applicants on January 8, 2021.

In this role you will

  • Support the CGSR organization through contributions to ongoing research activities. Tasks may include literature reviews, annotated bibliographies, and contributions to workshops and summary reports.
  • Provide analysis to ongoing work, involving a moderate to high degree of complexity.
  • May assist in the planning of one workshop to support research effort.
  • Gather and analyze data and information in support of research.
  • Conduct an independent research project on an agreed upon topic aligned with CGSR research priorities.
  • Participate in research planning and evaluation discussions.
  • Attend relevant seminars and/or conferences.
  • Present research to LLNL staff at end of the assignment.
  • May prepare end-of-assignment technical report.
  • Perform all assignments in accordance with ES&H, security, and business practice requirements and policies.
  • Perform other duties as assigned.
Qualifications

  • Must have completed a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Political Science, International Relations, Mathematics, Bio-engineering, Psychology, Computer Science, Physical Science, or related disciplines.
  • Demonstrated academic achievement in Political Science, International Relations, Mathematics, Bio-engineering, Psychology, Computer Science, or related disciplines.
  • Experience applying basic engineering or scientific principles to solve technical problems.
  • Ability to work in a team environment.

Why Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory?

  • Comprehensive Benefits Package

Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory (LLNL), located in the San Francisco Bay Area (East Bay), is a premier applied science laboratory that is part of the National Nuclear Security Administration (NNSA) within the Department of Energy (DOE). LLNL's mission is strengthening national security by developing and applying cutting-edge science, technology, and engineering that respond with vision, quality, integrity, and technical excellence to scientific issues of national importance. The Laboratory has a current annual budget of about $1.5 billion, employing approximately 6,000 employees.

Research Intern: Collaborative Intelligence Is it you we're looking for?

Are you a highly motivated researcher who is enrolled in a PhD program at a top university in a relevant subject like Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Mathematics, or Statistics? Do you aim to work in a diverse research environment among some of the world's leading researchers? Are you an excellent communicator who thrives on a multi-disciplinary team? If so, keep reading.

Imec USA is looking for a PhD student intern for an exciting new research program on Low power distributed and collaborative artificial intelligence (AI) leveraging on-device learning at our Berkeley location in California, for Summer 2021.

What you will do
  • Develop novel multi-agent learning algorithms and mechanisms that help solve a global task by sub-dividing the task amongst agents and collaborate amongst each other to solve the task.
  • Develop training environments, tasks and domains in which collaboration and cooperation are crucial for success, learnable but non-trivial.
Key Qualifications
  • Currently enrolled in PhD program in a top university in a relevant discipline such as Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Mathematics, or Statistics.
  • Experience with:
    *Developing novel multi-agent reinforcement learning algorithms for cooperative AI
    *Deep knowledge of Deep Reinforcement learning algorithms and literature
    *Good knowledge of game-theory and mechanism design.
    *Designing, implementing, and training DL/RL algorithms in state of the frameworks such as Pytorch and tensor-flow
  • Experience working in R&D environments with successful publications, patents or both is preferred
  • Can present your research effectively at conferences and in other technical forums.
  • Highly motivated to work in a research environment
  • Excellent communication skills and ability to work in a multidisciplinary team
What we do for you

In exchange for your talent, passion and expertise, you will join an ambitious organization, with challenges there for the taking.  You will have an assigned mentor to guide you through this highly valuable, hands on learning experience. You will work with top researchers from imec and from our industry partners.

About imec

Imec is a world-leading research and innovation hub in nanoelectronics and digital technologies. We leverage our world-class infrastructure and global ecosystem of partners across diverse industries to enable groundbreaking innovation in application domains, including healthcare, smart cities, mobility, logistics, manufacturing, and energy.

Imec USA, Nanoelectronics Design Center is an R&D center facilitating collaboration between imec's Belgian headquarters and U.S.-based semiconductor and system companies, universities, and research institutes. This opportunity is based at our newest research center in Berkeley, led by long-term technology pioneer and visionary Jan Rabaey. Here, we dive into mid-to-long-term outcomes of technological evolutions. We are currently focusing on developing novel architectures for machine learning and artificial intelligence and system technology co-optimization exploration.

At imec, we believe that talent grows technology, and technology grows talent. Our informal and progressive working environment offers a range of possibilities to take the initiative and grow in responsibility.

position: Device Ecosystem Engineering Intern, Partner Ecosystem
description:
Who are we?
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 200+ million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Netflix is reinventing entertainment from end to end. We are revolutionizing how shows and movies are produced, pushing technological boundaries to efficiently deliver streaming video at massive scale over the internet, and continuously improving and personalizing how content is presented around the globe. 

The Device Ecosystem Engineering (DEE) team delivers Netflix on hundreds of millions of partner devices from smart TV's to MVPD Set Top Boxes to streaming sticks. The team collaborates with partners across the globe to deliver the Netflix Streaming Client  on their devices, which is a core part of the Netflix experience.
 
We want to delight our customers with a service that just works, always. We are looking for a talented software engineer to explore and lay the groundwork for us to deliver a world-class highly reliable Netflix application. Our partner devices run a diverse set of operating systems including other 3rd party technologies with multiple stakeholder companies spread around the world, making the scaling of the Netflix application a unique challenge. We continue to drive forward the state of the art for streaming device product experiences, globally, through the use of our partnerships.
Who are you?
  • Experience with Operating Systems (Linux/Android/POSIX), Native Languages (C/C++), Scripting (Javascript/Python).
  • Experience with data structures, algorithms, embedded software development, and source control systems like GIT or similar.
  • Passionate about device automation interfacing to backend systems.
  • Planning for future coursework in Distributed Systems, Computer Architecture, Networking, Streaming etc.
  • MS or PhD pursuing Computer Science, Computer/Software Engineering.
What will you learn?
  • Different device platforms, middlewares, and media pipelines.
  • Impact of tooling to build best quality products for scale.
  • Impact of global partnerships to business growth and customer joy.
  • Collaboration and Communication skills working with multiple stakeholders.
  • Products at the nexus of Embedded Technology and Entertainment. 
The Summer Internship
Our approach to internships is different: like Netflix itself, we offer a personalized experience for interns, and our aim is to offer an experience that mimics what it is like to actually work here. We match qualified interns with projects and groups based on interests and skill sets, and fully embed interns within those groups for the summer. Netflix is a unique place to work and we live by our values, so it's worth learning more about our culture.

Internships will be a minimum of 12 weeks, with timing flexible to candidate needs. We expect these internships to be remote. Conditions permitting, we will aim to bring the intern cohort together for an optional experience at some point during the summer.

We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

This is for a summer 2021 remote internship, you must be graduating December 2021 or later. Please do not apply for more than two internship positions.

Our Mission

At Palo Alto Networks everything starts and ends with our mission:

Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life.

We have the vision of a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. These aren't easy goals to accomplish - but we're not here for easy. We're here for better. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we're looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are.

Job Description

Your Career

We are looking for a talented and motivated intern who will be able to conceive, design, implement and evaluate distributed systems that run at large scale. You will work on building up infrastructure in all aspects to serve real time, streaming pipeline to serve our intelligent cloud service. Help explore, research, prototype and identify the cutting edge technology to apply to existing cloud service in the near future.

 

Your Impact

  • The opportunity to expose yourself to the full landscape of cybersecurity

  • You will learn technologies that lay the foundations of cloud computing

  • Gain hands-on experience with scalable, extensible and real-time distributed systems

  • The opportunity to work with self-motivated, intelligent, creative and hardworking team that continuously delivers and improves the most successful cloud system of Palo Alto Networks

Qualifications

Your Experience

  • Hands on experience of golang and python

  • Solid knowledge of computer theory, architecture, and algorithm

  • Web application development (React, Django) experience is a plus

  • Linux knowledge or experience is a plus

  • Knowledge about data stream processing technology is a plus

  • Have great passion and curiosity in cutting-edge technologies, and is highly self-motivated to get things done

Requirements - To apply, you must be pursuing a 4-year Undergraduate Degree with a GPA of 3.0 or above, a 2-year Master's Degree or a Doctorate degree and returning to school in the fall. You must have the authorization to work within the United States.

Additional Information

Our Summer Internship Program from May-August or June-September provides you:

  • 1:1 mentorship

  • Fun and engaging events that inspire your intellectual curiosity

  • The opportunity to expand your knowledge and work on challenging projects

  • Connections to other recent grads, and employees across the company as well as our leaders

 

The Team

Threat research systems team is responsible for working on data processing platforms and pipelines for threat intelligence research . We work directly with product managers, researchers and data scientists to provide URL analysis platform and distributed sample analysis systems. We build scalable, reliable, and manageable infrastructures providing great throughput that deliver services and intelligence. Lots of fun and latest advanced technologies are being tested and embedded into our systems constantly to make our services and platforms more reliable, efficient and accountable.

Our Commitment

We're trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity's status quo. It's simple: we can't accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together.

We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at [email protected]

Build the analytics to help Flexport growThe opportunity:

As a Data Analytics Intern, you will work alongside self-starters interested in solving real-world problems and streamlining the inefficiencies in the complex global trade industry. You'll have the opportunity to improve an industry by analyzing the new operating system for global trade. You will own and work through an entire data analytics project end-to-end over 12 weeks. 

It will ultimately culminate in delivering a production ready feature and presenting it and your process to our team of makers. The Data Analytics team at Flexport has an enormous variety in the types of projects they work on and covers all Flexport departments, including Growth Marketing, Operations Excellence, Ocean Procurement, and everything in between.

You will:
  • Lead and complete at least one data analytics project that will be used in production.
  • Work with a supportive mentor who has a stake in your success and will help you grow.
  • Work cross-functionally with the entirety of Flexport - analytics, engineering, product, and business teams.
  • Apply analytical and statistical concepts from your education and work experience to real world challenges.
  • Learn and use our modern analytics tech stack, including dbt, Airflow, Snowflake, and Looker.
You should have:
  • Rising senior actively pursuing a Bachelor's degree in a STEM field, or have previous internship experience in an analyst role.
  • Completed coursework in statistics, mathematics, computer science, or related fields.
  • SQL fluency, with experience using a scripting language like Python or R. Strong Excel fundamentals a plus.
  • Experience with data visualization tools (Looker preferred).
Bonus:
  • Bring experience and/or knowledge of something we can learn from you! Internships are at their best when they're bi-directional.
  • We value culture adds, not culture fits, so bring your full, authentic self!
About Flexport:

We believe global trade can move the human race forward. That's why it's our mission to make global trade easier for everyone. We aim to do this by building the Operating System for Global trade - a strategic model combining advanced technology and data analytics, logistics infrastructure, and supply chain expertise. Flexport today connects almost 10,000 clients and suppliers across 109 countries, including established global brands like Georgia-Pacific as well as emerging innovators like Sonos. Started in 2013, we've raised over $1.3B in funding from SoftBank Vision Fund, Founders Fund, GV, First Round Capital and Y Combinator. We're excited about the three big ways we're moving forward after our recent $1B investment from SoftBank Vision Fund in February 2019.

Worried about not having any freight forwarding experience?
  • Don't be! We're building the first Operating System for Global Trade. That's why it's incredibly important for us to bring people from diverse backgrounds and experiences together with our industry veterans to help move the freight forwarding industry forward.
  • What's freight forwarding and why does it matter? Freight forwarding is the coordination and shipment of goods from one place to another and it's what makes global trade possible. Flexport is on a mission to make global trade easier for everyone because we believe it can help connect the world and break down economic barriers.
  • We know this industry is complex. That's why we invest in education starting day one with Flexport Academy, a one week intensive onboarding program designed specifically to set every new Flexport employee up for success.

At Flexport, our ability to fulfill our mission of making global trade easy for everyone relies on having a diverse, dedicated and engaged workforce. That is why Flexport is committed to creating and nurturing an environment where anyone can be their authentic self. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, physical and mental disability, health status, marital and family status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, military and veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

description:

The intern will work closely with their mentor throughout the duration of the internship. The opportunity is more than "sit back and observe", our interns are integrated into daily duties of their respective departments, attend various meetings, and assist on departmental projects as assigned. BECU interns bring a welcome perspective to our organization. An internship at BECU empowers you to confidently move forward in your career path, having a valued voice in our organization. Note: all summer 2021 internships will be remote/virtual.

Intern Supervisor: Scientist III
Department: Research (Technology)
Location: Richmond

Sangamo Therapeutics is a genomic medicine company building value with cutting-edge work across four distinct but complementary technology platforms – gene therapy, cell therapy, in vivo genome editing, and in vivo genome regulation. At Sangamo, we are committed to creating an inclusive environment that promotes and values diversity. We are dedicated to providing an innovative space where students can engage in meaningful work and collaborate with professionals in the biotech industry through our internship program. Sangamo’s internship program gives students the opportunity to flourish, grow and develop their expertise. We are a company that inspires and empowers everyone who works here to grow and be better than they believe they can be in our mission to collectively transform patients’ lives.

We are seeking passionate, curious, and innovative interns to contribute to our mission. Let’s build a better future together.

What Will You Get Out of This Summer Internship?
  • Opportunity to obtain valuable real-world experience in a biotech setting, while gaining specific field-related exposure, and making important professional connections.
  • Discover if a particular career path or field of study in the biotech industry is right for you.
  • Engage in our fun and collaborative company culture while participating in team wide social events.
  • Receive compensation through this paid internship.
  • Consideration for future full-time positions or contract roles.

Scope of Timeline
  • December: Applications open
  • Mid- February: Application close (may still consider application if we have openings left)
  • February through March: Offers made
  • June through August: Internship period

Program Requirements
  • Must be 18 years of age prior to scheduled start date
  • Must be legally authorized to work in the U.S.
  • Must be able to commit to the full 10-12 weeks’ time frame between June and August.
  • Interns will be expected to work 40 hours a week.
  • We accept applications from students at all degree levels: BS, MS, and PhD.
  • Candidates are eligible to apply to the internship within one year of their last degree attained.
  • We do not have a GPA requirement.
  • Applicants must have completed at least one year of accredited university or community college course work to be considered for an internship.
  • We currently do not offer visa sponsorship to interns.

INTERNSHIP PROJECT SUMMARY:
Sangamo Therapeutics is seeking a motivated intern to work on Zinc Finger Nuclease (ZFN) screening platform development. The successful candidate will participate in the development of innovative and high throughput processes to assemble and screen specific ZFNs in various cell types. The candidate will also assist in data analysis automation and Illumina NGS sequencers operation. The work is exciting, fast-paced and may directly impacts the company’s scope and capabilities.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
  • Participate in ZFN assembly process optimization to increase the assembly efficiency and throughput
  • Explore low-cost in-vitro mRNA synthesis methods
  • Develop high throughput transfection protocols for new cell lines
  • Assist in NGS core operation and data analysis processes automation
  • Analyze results and document them in e-notebook

EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS REQUIREMENTS:
  • Major in molecular biology, genetics, biochemistry, or related field
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Knowledge of gene editing technologies is a plus
  • Prior experience in an academic or biotech research laboratory is a plus
  • Computer programming (e.g. python) is a plus
Any questions, please feel free to contact us here.

Sangamo is an equal opportunity employer

The above reflects management’s definition of essential functions for this position but does not restrict the tasks that may be assigned. The above duties are representative only; management may assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this position at any time.

Micron’s vision is to transform how the world uses information to enrich life for all. ​ Join an inclusive team focused on one thing: using our expertise in the relentless pursuit of innovation for customers and partners. The solutions we create help make everything from virtual reality experiences to breakthroughs in neural networks possible. We do it all while committing to integrity, sustainability, and giving back to our communities. Because doing so can spark the very innovation we are pursuing. 

 

Req. ID: 252030 

 

Micron Technology’s vision is to transform how the world uses information to enrich life and our commitment to people, innovation, tenacity, collaboration, and customer focus allows us to fulfill our mission to be a global leader in memory and storage solutions. This means conducting business with integrity, accountability, and professionalism while supporting our global community.

Are you passionate about semiconductors and fabrication? Micron is looking for motivated students for hands on work in semiconductor memory failure analysis. As a Technology Development (TD) Software intern in physical failure analysis (PFA) group at Micron, you will get an opportunity to work on and optimize leading edge memory technology development.

Qualifications:
  • Self-motivated and enthusiastic to find creative solutions to challenges
  • Passionate about learning semiconductor memory and fabrication.
  • Drive to succeed and ability to energize the team
  • Highly motivated with good analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Excellent written, communication and presentation skills
  • Ambitious and able to work with minimal supervision
  • Possess a continuous improvement process (CIP) mindset where you are always looking for ways to improve the operations of the area
Preferred:
  • Experience with C/C++ and Python with a solid foundation in object-oriented programming
  • Familiarity with Java, C#, Go, or Rust is a strong plus
  • Experience with Linux software development and basic Linux systems administration
  • Experience with Windows, Office
  • Experience with databases (e.g., MySQL or MongoDB).

The Yield Enhancement group is a multi-disciplinary group, drawing engineers from Chemical, Materials, Electrical, Statistics and device physics. TD YE-PFA team collaborates with a diverse and talented team to isolate the root cause of the failures, enabling process integration to deliver the next generation of memory process nodes to production fab (high volume manufacturing). PFA engineers require knowledge of semiconductor device physics, fabrication, operation, architecture, and statistics. PFA group routinely uses bench testers, emission and laser techniques for fail isolation. In addition, work with FIBs, SEMs and TEMs to understand the root cause of the failure.

Focus of the internship is collaboration with other teams inside the Micron to develop improved strategy for failure analysis and seeking out opportunities for an improved collaboration between the groups so we can deliver a unified solution for yield improvement.

Responsibilities:
  • Collaborate with probe, product engineering, process engineering and processes integration engineers to develop an improved strategy for failure analysis
  • Innovate creative ways improve work efficiency and shorten the time it takes to localize root cause failures
  • Interpret, summarize, and present data to corresponding engineers verbal as well as written.
  • Build and improve new techniques and find exceptional ways to use the existing tools in order to identify meaningful process issues
  • Collaborate with other groups to improve overall product yield and performance.
  • Testing processes by evaluating/coding software to improve productivity
Education:

Pursuing a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field. Must have a graduation date of December 2021 or later. 

 Micron is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values People, Innovation, Customer Focus, Tenacity and Collaboration.

 

About Micron Technology, Inc.

We are an industry leader in innovative memory and storage solutions. Through our global brands – Micron® and Crucial® – our broad portfolio of high-performance memory and storage technologies, including DRAM, NAND, 3D XPoint™ memory and NOR, is transforming how the world uses information to enrich life. Backed by more than 40 years of technology leadership, our memory and storage solutions enable disruptive trends, including artificial intelligence, 5G, machine learning and autonomous vehicles, in key market segments like mobile, data center, client, consumer, industrial, graphics, automotive, and networking. Our common stock is traded on the Nasdaq under the MU symbol. To learn more visit micron.com/careers

Corning is one of the world's leading innovators in materials science. For more than 160 years, Corning has applied its unparalleled expertise in specialty glass, ceramics, and optical physics to develop products that have created new industries and transformed people's lives.

At Corning, our growth is fueled by a commitment to innovation. We succeed through sustained investment in research & development, a unique combination of material and process innovation, and close collaboration with customers to solve tough technology challenges. We are a four-time National Medal of Technology winner thanks to our technology leadership and R&D environment, which attract and enable the best scientific minds in the world. This pipeline of talent has brought life-changing innovation to your fingertips for more than 160 years.

Scope of Position:

Corning's summer internship experience is rich with hands-on learning. You'll live, work, and experience the communities in which Corning operates, while building on-the-job skills. As our intern, you will be involved with Research and Development within Corning's Scientific & Technologies (S&T) segment. As our intern you will work on a multi-disciplinary team to design, test and demonstrate devices for use in cell culture. You will be responsible for performing cell culture, image analysis and data analysis and problem solve issues. At the internship conclusion you will provide a technical presentation of your work at Corning.

Our internship will offer you:

  • Community Involvement

  • Perform detailed adherent cell culture experiments in both standard and non-standard vessels
  • Problem solve bioprocess issues with the team and perform root cause analysis
  • Collect proof-of-concept data using controlled laboratory experiments
  • Measure and document prototype performance

Hours of work/work schedule/flex-time:

  • M-F, 40 hours/week
  • Duration: Summer 2021; 8-12 weeks

Education and Experience:

  • Major in Bio-Engineering or relevant program
  • Masters or undergraduate level student who has completed at least three years coursework

Required Skills

  • Proficient in cell culture and imaging techniques
  • Knowledge of biology and engineering principles
  • Ability to safely conduct laboratory experiments

Desired Skills

Soft Skills (Communication/Team/Leadership):

By honoring this commitment, we have maintained our reputation as one of the best property casualty insurers in the industry for over 160 years. Join us to discover a culture that is rooted in innovation and thrives on collaboration. Imagine loving what you do and where you do it.

Target Openings

Job Description Summary

Travelers has built a solid reputation as a leading insurance company and employs some of the most talented, passionate people in the industry and provides endless opportunities for those willing to reach for them. With over 105 years of experience in property risk control and safety management, plus leading industrial hygiene, fire and forensics laboratories, Travelers Risk Control has the expertise to provide customers with recommendations to help control hazards and reduce risks of property damage or injury. If you're driven and passionate about what you do and work each day to make an impact, you might be interested in an opportunity with Travelers.

Under direct supervision, the main responsibility of this internship opportunity is to develop risk control and general insurance industry knowledge, and to assist in providing risk control support as it relates to hazards, controls, and management in the construction industry. The Risk Control Safety Intern will work with a Field Director and mentor on a special project that is dependent on business need. This individual will gain a broader understanding of the Construction, Energy, and Marine operations via co-surveys and report reviews, as well as the risk control enterprise as a whole.

Primary Job Duties & Responsibilities

This 10-12 week, paid position is a virtual experience, with the potential of full-time conversion to one of the listed position locations.

  • Preparing, conducting, and completing virtual risk evaluations of client locations in order to determine the potential hazards and risk factors to be considered in risk selection.
  • Identifying uncontrolled hazards and making appropriate recommendations to involve consulting with clients on ways to control hazards to help them reduce, mitigate, or prevent loss.
  • Researching and applying technical information to support current risk control service efforts.
  • Attending co-surveys (may be done virtually) with experienced Risk Control staff to learn and develop consulting skills.
  • Collaborating with Underwriting, Claim, Clients, Business Partners within our Business Insurance unit, and other Risk Control staff in the Construction, Energy, and Marine line of business.
  • Completing one Capstone project and presentation to senior management on a relevant Risk Control topic.
  • Ensuring timely completion of assignments
  • Performing other duties as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications

  • GPA of 3.0 or higher in a relevant degree program: Environmental Health and Safety, Occupational Health, Allied Health, Fire Protection Engineering, Kinesiology, Construction Safety, Construction Management, Biochemistry, Chemistry, Computer and Digital Forensics, Civil or Industrial Engineering, Science or Business. Social Science and Humanities students with interest and aptitude will also be considered.
  • Must be registered as a returning student and have completed related work studies

Education, Work Experience, & Knowledge

    • Students pursuing a Bachelor's or Graduate degree in Construction Management/Engineering, Civil Engineering, Construction Safety, or similar strongly preferred.
    • Students expected to graduate December 2021-May 2022 strongly preferred.
    • Candidates must be open to relocation to one of the primary or secondary locations based on business needs.
    • Must be available to work 40 hours per week for the duration of the internship.
    • Knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite and other business-related software.

    Job Specific Technical Skills & Competencies

    • Leadership.
    • Excellent verbal and written communication skills and presentation abilities.
    • Strong self-awareness, interpersonal skills and relationship-building abilities.
    • Effective organizational skills.
    • Demonstrated critical thinking skills.
    • Propensity and desire to learn rapidly and adapt quickly to change.
    • Ability to work independently in a virtual environment.

    Employment Practices

    Travelers is an equal opportunity employer. We value the unique abilities and talents each individual brings to our organization and recognize that we benefit in numerous ways from our differences.


    If you have questions regarding the physical requirements of this role, please send us an email so we may assist you.


    Travelers reserves the right to fill this position at a level above or below the level included in this posting.

WHO WE ARE

Kinship, Mars Petcare's newest division, is a hotbed for future innovation, data science and analytics, and at the forefront of emerging technology for pets, pet owners and veterinarians. At Kinship, we move quickly to shape the future of pet care. We are Optimistic, Purposefully Inquisitive, Open to all, and passionate about what's possible. We're a coalition of bright minds, big ideas, and bold businesses united by our love of pets..

Part of Mars, Incorporated, a family-owned business with more than a century of history making diverse products and offering services for people and the pets people love, the 85,000 Associates in Mars Petcare are dedicated to one purpose: A BETTER WORLD FOR PETS. With 75 years of experience, our portfolio of almost 50 brands serves the health and nutrition needs of the world's pets and The WALTHAM Centre for Pet Nutrition has advanced research in the nutrition and health of pets for over 50 years. Mars Petcare is also a leading veterinary health provider through a network of over 2,000 pets. We're also active in innovation and technology for pets, with WISDOM PANEL™ genetic health screening and DNA testing for dogs, the WHISTLE™ GPS dog tracker, and LEAP VENTURE STUDIO accelerator and COMPANION FUND™ programs that drive innovation and disruption in the pet care industry.

OUR INTERNSHIP PROGRAM

Kinship is committed to providing interns with a valuable experience that will help build a strong foundation for entering into the workforce. In addition to a structured mentorship program, regular feedback, and networking opportunities, our interns are exposed to a broad variety of projects and will get to work on cross functional projects with other interns in their group. Our paid internship program will run for 13 weeks from January 25 - April 30. You can expect to work alongside 3-4 other interns in your location and will have the opportunity to present your project to our leadership team at the end of your internship.

OUR COMPANY WITHIN KINSHIP

WISDOM PANEL is the world leader in companion animal genetics, supporting the bond between people and pets by providing world-leading insights powered by DNA. We analyze DNA using a proprietary computer algorithm and an expansive breed database to identify the pure breed(s) present in their ancestry. We are the go to test for ancestry, traits, healthy weight prediction, and the most critical genetic mutation tests needed for your best buddy.

A BIT ABOUT OUR TEAM

Wisdom Health is seeking an intern to join our R&D team in the Portland, OR area. Working as part of Wisdom Health's R&D team you will work with senior bioinformaticians, geneticists, and veterinary researchers on a project supporting our consumer genetic products.

HOW YOU WILL CREATE A BETTER WORLD FOR PETS

  • Develop a tool or protocol to collect and/or analyze data associated with veterinary health
  • Carry out assessment and perform data analysis
  • Prepare and deliver a presentation summarizing work and proposing next steps.

WHO WE NEED TO HELP EVERYONE PET PARENT LIKE A PRO

For this role, we hope you have the following skills we require:

  • Must be currently enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate university program in the U.S. during the Spring 2021 semester and able to intern remotely or Hybrid
  • Minimum two years completion of an undergraduate Bachelor's degree
  • College Credit or better in Biostatistics or related field
  • Strong interest in pursuing a career in data analysis or population genetics.
  • Background in biology, bioinformatics, genetics, or similar.
  • Experience with Python or other is desirable, but not required.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Kinship takes being Open to All seriously. We encourage applications from individuals underrepresented in their field of study, and those that can potentially add new and valuable perspectives to the pet care and tech industries. Multicultural, Black, Indigenous and students of color, are strongly encouraged to apply

WHAT YOU'LL LEAVE THE EXPERIENCE WITH

  • Experience accessing a robust database, creating queries and developing consumer surveys
  • Experience Collaborating with other scientists

position: Systems Engineer Intern, DRIVE AV - Summer 2021
description:
NVIDIA's invention of the GPU in 1999 sparked the growth of the PC gaming market, redefined modern computer graphics, and revolutionized parallel computing. More recently, GPU deep learning ignited modern AI - the next era of computing - with the GPU acting as the brain of computers, robots, and self-driving cars that can perceive and understand the world! Today, we are increasingly known as "the AI computing company." Are you willing to challenge yourself, and build great software by working with the smartest people in the world? Join us at the forefront of technological advancement.

What you'll be doing:

  • Responsible for the technical relationship and assisting the automotive customer in building creative solutions based on Nvidia technology.

  • Responsible for integrating different hardware and software components optimally for customer products.

  • Provide technical support, bring up customer hardware, debug and resolve system issues.

  • Collaborate with engineering teams in our US, APAC, India and Europe locations.

  • Strong knowledge of scripting and Python

  • Excellent C and C++ programming skills

  • Experienced Linux user

  • Experience working with self-driving cars or other real-time robotics/mechatronics systems.

  • Experience with automotive design processes and norms

  • Excellent communication and organization skills, good time management and task prioritization.

  • Dedicated and able to work with minimum supervision.

  • Experience with GPGPU programming (CUDA and OpenCL)

NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Company Description

The Bosch Research and Technology Center North America with offices in Sunnyvale, California, Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania and Cambridge, Massachusetts is part of the global Bosch Group (www.bosch.com), a company with over 70 billion euro revenue, 400,000 people worldwide, a very diverse product portfolio, and a history of over 125 years. The Research and Technology Center North America (RTC-NA) is committed to providing technologies and system solutions for various Bosch business fields primarily in the areas of Human Machine Interaction (HMI), Robotics, Energy Technologies, Internet Technologies, Circuit Design, Semiconductors and Wireless, and MEMS Advanced Design.

At the Services team of the Bosch Center for Artificial Intelligence, we apply state of the art Data Analytics technologies and develop standardized tools to enable BOSCH business units to achieve cost savings and enable new IoT business.

Job Description
  • Be part of the technical service and engineering team of the Bosch Center for Artificial Intelligence
  • Work in Operations Research and Data Mining projects with real world datasets
  • Formulate and implement optimization models
  • Compare and select optimization algorithms and software packages
  • Perform tasks such as ETL, data cleaning, modeling, model validation and deployment
  • Implement software solutions with Analytics components

Qualifications

Required knowledge and skills:

  • Master's degree in the area of Business, Information Systems, Computer Science, Mathematics or similar
  • Strong background in mathematical optimization / Operations Research
  • Good programming skills required in at least 2 of the following programming languages: Python, Java, C#, C+, R
  • Experience with optimization software such as Gurobi, Cplex or similar
  • Experience with both exact optimization (LP, MIP, CP) as well as heuristic optimization (construction heuristics, metaheuristics)
  • Excellent problem solving ability
  • Ability to consolidate business and technical requirements
  • Excellent verbal and written communication and presentation skills with the ability to communicate technical and non-technical topics

Additional skills:

  • Knowledge of Data Mining algorithms is a plus
  • Experience in manufacturing or supply chain applications is a plus
  • Experience in applying Analytics to practical problems preferred

Additional Information

By choice, we are committed to a diverse workforce - EOE/Protected Veteran/Disabled.

BOSCH is a proud supporter of STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics) Initiatives

  • FIRST Robotics (For Inspiration and Recognition of Science and Technology)
  • AWIM (A World in Motion)

Salelytics is for a person with experience in Office 365 and customer service skills for our Tech Services department. One in Appleton WI and one in San Antonio TX.

Job Description


Responsible for providing assistance to customers needing to resolve problems with their computer systems in an enterprise and multi-site infrastructure by answering service requests; work with the customer to determine the nature of the problem then follow the problem until final resolution; perform daily equipment checks to ensure equipment is functioning properly; monitor enterprise system functions and activities

Job Responsibilities


Technical Services Functions - Participate in providing enterprise-wide computer systems and peripheral support while ensuring adherence to corporate and department policies and procedures

  • Work with customer to determine the nature of the technical problem then follow the problem until the final resolution for the customer 
  • Ensure work orders have been addressed and properly closed out
  • upgrade, configure hardware/software and troubleshoot/maintain corporate PCs and peripherals 
  • Ensure high levels of customer satisfaction is provided during each point of contact with customers
  • Immediately notify appropriate individuals of any problems that could potentially impact production activities.
  • Follow appropriate escalation procedures regarding service requests and complete related follow-up activities as necessary 
  • Maintain confidentiality of information during PC configuration or maintenance
  • Assist department personnel with the configuration and maintenance of data communication systems
  • Implement an action plan including performing required upgrades and installation of PCs and required peripheral equipment.
  • Assist department personnel with the configuration and maintenance of data communication systems
  • Install and repair wiring and cabling as required on location, as necessary provide telecommunications support including telephone installation and maintenance
  • Systems Monitoring and Operations - Perform daily equipment checks to ensure equipment is functioning properly in a multi-site environment.
  • Monitor various system functions and activities, which may include PC equipment, corporate LAN systems, servers, departmental printers, and telecommunications equipment in order to identify issues and resolve them or attempt to resolve them before they cause problems
  • Be proactive to avoid or minimize system problems that could potentially impact production activities.

Minimum Qualifications
 

Applicants for this job will be expected to meet the following minimum qualifications.
 

Education

  • High school diploma or GED required. Associate degree in computer science, MIS, or related field is preferred


Experience

  • Minimum of one-year experience in technical support services or customer service environment required, preferably in a corporate environment
    Technical
  • Minimum one year of PC hardware, Windows operating systems, DOS, PC/LAN environment, monitoring systems and tools required.
  • Minimum one year of corporate applications and systems preferred 


Other

The following physical and mental requirements may be required for this position.


Physical Requirements: 

  • Must be able to list 45 lbs. 
  • Frequently will finger, grasp, and sit
  • Occasionally may be asked to bend, stoop, carry items which may weigh more than 45 lbs,
  • Climb stairs, work in a confined space, crawl, kneel, push, reach above the shoulder, do repetitive motions, stand, walk, or lift objects (some heavy) above the head

Company Description

The Bosch Research and Technology Center North America with offices in Sunnyvale, California, Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania and Cambridge, Massachusetts is part of the global Bosch Group (www.bosch.com), a company with over 70 billion euro revenue, 400,000 people worldwide, a very diverse product portfolio, and a history of over 125 years. The Research and Technology Center North America (RTC-NA) is committed to providing technologies and system solutions for various Bosch business fields primarily in the areas of Human Machine Interaction (HMI), Robotics, Energy Technologies, Internet Technologies, Circuit Design, Semiconductors and Wireless, and MEMS Advanced Design.

At our location in Pittsburgh, you will be part of a cutting-edge entrepreneurial research environment at the core of Bosch's AI effort and take advantage of academic partnerships via our multi-year sponsorship of leading international universities such as Carnegie Mellon University.

Job Description

We are looking for enthusiastic interns to join our research team to develop novel approaches of using external unstructured or structured information to improve predictions of an NLP model. The most likely scenario involves retrieving evidence to support/refute the model's prediction. More specifically the internship role will focus on the following responsibilities:

  • Design novel algorithms to retrieve and incorporate external knowledge into a model prediction process
  • Technical discussions and creation of new ideas within the existing research team, in order to improve upon the existing solutions
  • Evaluation of the designed approaches using Bosch data as well as publicly available data sets
  • Clean, efficient, and well-documented implementation of new deep learning methods
  • Publish at leading AI conferences, and ultimately shape the future of Bosch products and services.
Qualifications

Qualifications Required:

  • Pursuing a PhD degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Electrical Engineering, or Mathematics
  • 2+ years of experience in Machine Learning, or Deep Learning
  • 2+ years of programming experience
  • 1+ years experience with Pytorch (and possibly other deep learning frameworks)
  • Established publication record in Machine Learning, Information Retrieval, or Natural Language processing
  • Excellent communication skills

Qualifications Desired:

Department OverviewThe 9-1-1 Call Handling business is made up of two key segments, Emergency Call Routing and Emergency Call Taking. Emergency Call Routing is the next generation IP network combined with software that allows transport of an emergency call, text, video or IOT alert to the correct public safety answering point using geospatial routing. Additional supplemental data - such as real time location of the caller or emergency health profile data can also be displayed to help drive better outcomes.
